questions.uddipok:
The following sentences are jumbled. Rearrange them in proper sequence.
(a) The crow at last thought of a plan to get rid of its enemy.
(b) It stole an expensive necklace of the princess from the royal palace and dropped it into the snake's hole after scattering a few rubles here and there.
(c) A snake lived in a hole at the foot of a tree.
(d) The king became very angry at the loss and sent out men to look for the necklace.
(e) High up on its branches was the nest of a crow.
(f) In this way the snake ate up three of the chicks.
(g) The crow had four young chicks in its nest.
(h) In course of time, they noticed the scattered rubies near the hole.
(i) Whenever the crow would leave the nest to bring food for its chicks, the snake would climb and eat one.
(j). They dug the hole, killed the snake and took the necklace.

sub_questions.explanation:
( c ) → ( e ) → ( g ) → ( i ) → ( f ) → ( a ) → ( b ) → ( d ) → ( h ) → ( j ) (\mathrm{c}) \rightarrow(\mathrm{e}) \rightarrow(\mathrm{g}) \rightarrow(\mathrm{i}) \rightarrow(\mathrm{f}) \rightarrow(\mathrm{a}) \rightarrow(\mathrm{b}) \rightarrow(\mathrm{d}) \rightarrow(\mathrm{h}) \rightarrow(\mathrm{j}) ( c ) → ( e ) → ( g ) → ( i ) → ( f ) → ( a ) → ( b ) → ( d ) → ( h ) → ( j )
A snake lived in a hole at the foot of a tree. High up on its branches was the nest of a crow. The crow had four young chicks in its nest. Whenever the crow would leave the nest to bring food for its chicks, the snake would climb and eat one. In this way, the snake ate up three of the chicks. The crow at last thought of a plan to get rid of its enemy. It stole an expensive necklace of the princess from the Royal Palace and dropped it into the snake's hole after scattering a few rubies here and there. The king became very angry at the loss and sent out men to look for the necklace. In course of time, they noticed the scattered rubies near the hole. They dug the hole, killed the snake and took the necklace.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph in 250 words on "Digital Bangladesh".

sub_questions.explanation:
Digital Bangladesh
"Digital Bangladesh" is a visionary initiative launched by the government of Bangladesh to transform the country into a knowledge-based society through the use of information and communication technology (ICT). The concept, introduced by Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in 2008, aims to harness the power of digital technology to improve various sectors, such as education, healthcare, governance, and business, thereby promoting overall national development. One of the key aspects of Digital Bangladesh is the expansion of internet connectivity across the country, including rural areas, which has enabled millions of people to access information, communicate, and participate in the digital economy.
The government has made significant investments in building infrastructure for digital services, including the development of e-governance systems, digital banking, and online education platforms. These initiatives have not only increased the efficiency of public services but have also provided greater transparency and accountability. In education, online learning platforms and digital classrooms have made learning more accessible, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic, when schools shifted to virtual classes.
Furthermore, the rise of the digital economy has created new opportunities for young entrepreneurs in e-commerce, freelancing, and digital marketing. The government's efforts to develop digital skills among the youth through training programs have led to an increase in the number of IT professionals, contributing to the country’s growing tech industry.
Despite the progress, challenges remain, such as digital literacy gaps, cybersecurity concerns, and the need for further infrastructure development in remote areas. However, the vision of Digital Bangladesh continues to evolve, aiming for an inclusive, technology-driven future for all its citizens.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on "Money and Happiness". Use not more than 200 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
Money and Happiness
It is an undeniable fact that both money and happiness are important factors in anybody's life. Both are very essential in our life. We earn money to get everything necessary in life. But money can't buy happiness. No matter how difficult it is to earn money, to gain happiness is even more difficult. Even after having enough money, we can't guarantee happiness. Money is one thing, and happiness is quite another. Although we can have enough money for our basic necessities, happiness doesn't always come along with that. It is possible that despite being rich, one is still not happy. On the contrary, a poor man can live in happiness as happiness lies in contentment. There is nothing wrong about wanting to earn more money, but one should not forget one's family and social life. In the pursuit of wealth, one may lose one's most important relationships with friends and family. Furthermore, our mental and physical health can be affected badly because of dissatisfaction and lack of selfdiscipline. Besides, if a man gets embroiled in social crisis, money itself cannot relieve him of the pains. Therefore, money is not essential to happiness.
